name: Fynnodderee

attributes.attribute: evicted from the Otherworld for missing too many Fairy dances while pursuing non-fairy maidens
roamed about, neither of this world nor the other
unable to settle down or to cut his long shaggy hair
could be as helpful as a Brownie

sources: Keightley, Thomas. The Fairy Mythology. London: H. G. Bohn, 1870.
Monaghan, Patricia. The Encyclopedia of Celtic Mythology and Folklore. Checkmark Books, 2008.
text: The Fynnodderee, a character in Manx folklore, was known as the "hairy one" of the Isle of Man due to his long, shaggy hair. He had a fondness for human women, to the point that he was expelled from the Otherworld for neglecting Fairy dances in his pursuit of non-fairy maidens. As a result, he wandered without a fixed abode and was neither entirely of this world nor the other. Despite his isolated existence, however, he showed kindness to humans and could be as helpful as a Brownie.
